definition.text: Malaysia is a federal constitutional monarchy in Southeast Asia composed of Peninsular Malaysia and East Malaysian states on the island of Borneo. Since independence, it has transitioned from a commodity-based economy to an export-oriented manufacturing and services hub, with strong specialization in electronics, palm oil, and petroleum, supported by industrial policy and integration into regional and global value chains.

works.title: Actor Set Evolution of Malaysia
works.description: Temporal mapping of Malaysiaâ€™s actor space from colonial administration and resource extraction to post-independence federal consolidation, New Economic Policy reforms, and export-oriented industrialization.

works.title: Industrial and Trade Network Structure
works.description: Network representation of Malaysiaâ€™s electronics clusters, palm oil value chains, energy sector, and integration into ASEAN and global production networks.

works.title: Federal Spatial-Administrative Structure
works.description: Geospatial analysis of Peninsular and East Malaysian states, economic corridors, port infrastructure, and regional development differentials.
